messages.content:
You are a home meal cooking assistant that will help us plan meals based on recipes and data we send you. Ideally we will not have too many repeat meals a week so keep that in mind as you go. We like to shop on Sundays and cook a lot that day to use for lunch during the week.
Then send the team and email with any updates.Help me make a weekly meal plan, with breakfast, lunch, dinner
Ideally there are left overs for lunch so those recipes should be enough for 2 and that 

Then as the weeks go on ideally meals will change based on our feedback and not repeating all the time

Out meal plan ideally is based on the following core ingredients
fresh vegetables ideally seasonal.
We live in Massachusetts [TIME_OF_YEAR]



Where 
Carrots, potatoes, cauliflower, broccoli, mushrooms peppers and anything like that really.

Chicken breast, thighs etc. 
Turkey mince, beef steak, shrimp, sausage 

Tofu  so not every night is meat though fish is great 

stir-fry is great, Dumplings, pesto etc.

Tacos nights a great with fish, pickled onions.

So as you can see mixes of fresh cooked foods.

Breakfast can be simple just oatmeal, or toast and advocado
Using the surrounding context to continue this response thread

Review meals and any updates in the chat thread. Consider adding items to the meal list todo.
For example "Feedback about Mondays Chicken Dinner" so the user remembers to do these things.
Also get a list of tasks and if some are past due email the team those updates.
Or if new content has come into the site consider using that as a message to the user.

content.text:
<thinking>{"message":"Hello Team,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with an update on our meal planning and preparation process. Here's a summary of our current tasks and some new additions:

Current Tasks:
1. Sunday Meal Planning and Shopping (Due: 2024-09-29)
   - Plan meals for the week and create a shopping list based on seasonal ingredients and preferences.

2. Sunday Meal Prep (Due: 2024-09-29)
   - Prepare meals for the week, focusing on dishes that can be partially or fully prepared in advance.

3. Weekday Dinner Preparation (Due: 2024-09-30)
   - Finalize dinner preparations using pre-prepped ingredients and quick cooking methods.

4. Weekly Meal Plan Review (Due: 2024-10-06)
   - Review the success of the previous week's meal plan and gather feedback for improvements.

New Tasks Added:
1. Provide daily meal feedback (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Write brief notes on each meal's success, taste, and any improvements for next time.

2. Check for seasonal ingredient updates (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Research what new seasonal ingredients are available in Massachusetts for the upcoming week.

3. Plan next week's meals (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Based on this week's feedback and seasonal ingredients, start planning next week's meals.

These new tasks will help us refine our meal planning process, ensure we're using the best seasonal ingredients, and continuously improve our meals based on feedback.

Remember to complete the daily feedback task to help with future meal planning. Also, keep an eye out for any new seasonal ingredients that we can incorporate into our meals.

If you have any questions or suggestions, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Happy cooking!

Best regards,
Your Meal Planning Assistant"}</thinking>

input.message:
Hello Team,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with an update on our meal planning and preparation process. Here's a summary of our current tasks and some new additions:

Current Tasks:
1. Sunday Meal Planning and Shopping (Due: 2024-09-29)
   - Plan meals for the week and create a shopping list based on seasonal ingredients and preferences.

2. Sunday Meal Prep (Due: 2024-09-29)
   - Prepare meals for the week, focusing on dishes that can be partially or fully prepared in advance.

3. Weekday Dinner Preparation (Due: 2024-09-30)
   - Finalize dinner preparations using pre-prepped ingredients and quick cooking methods.

4. Weekly Meal Plan Review (Due: 2024-10-06)
   - Review the success of the previous week's meal plan and gather feedback for improvements.

New Tasks Added:
1. Provide daily meal feedback (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Write brief notes on each meal's success, taste, and any improvements for next time.

2. Check for seasonal ingredient updates (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Research what new seasonal ingredients are available in Massachusetts for the upcoming week.

3. Plan next week's meals (Due: 2024-10-05)
   - Based on this week's feedback and seasonal ingredients, start planning next week's meals.

These new tasks will help us refine our meal planning process, ensure we're using the best seasonal ingredients, and continuously improve our meals based on feedback.

Remember to complete the daily feedback task to help with future meal planning. Also, keep an eye out for any new seasonal ingredients that we can incorporate into our meals.

If you have any questions or suggestions, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Happy cooking!

Best regards,
Your Meal Planning Assistant

system:
You are a home meal cooking assistant that will help us plan meals based on recipes and data we send you. Ideally we will not have too many repeat meals a week so keep that in mind as you go. We like to shop on Sundays and cook a lot that day to use for lunch during the week.
Then send the team and email with any updates.

tools.name: create_tasks_tool
tools.description: If the Project needs to have tasks created or the users prompt requires it you can use this tool to make multiple tasks

assistant.description: Should the assistant be assigned this true or false

user_id.description: User id if assigned to a user

tools.name: send_email_to_team
tools.description: Send an email to the team

message.description: The message for the body of the email

tools.name: list_tasks
tools.description: This will list all tasks that are still open unless you request closed instead

state.description: open or closed will be open by default
